On 28 Mar 2007 06:46:04 -0700, roman.kitko <roman.kitko@...> wrote:
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "David Saff" <saff@...> wrote:
>  >
>  > Roman,
>  >
>  > It sounds like you are in the market for JUnitExt:
>  >
>  > http://junitext.sourceforge.net/
>  >
>  > Let me know if that has what you want.  Thanks,
>  >
>  >    David Saff
>  >
>
>  Hi David,
>
>  I have implemented this myself, it was really easy :
>  create FilteredTestClassMethodsRunner,TestMethodDescriptionEx and Filter.
>
>  I have just wanted to point, that if API allows as to filter running
>  tests based on Description class, than Description class should be
>  rich enough and provide significant information of test - Method object.
>

Roman, I see what you are up to and it looks very interesting.
However, I would strongly encourage you to take a look at how TestNG
is handling groups, because I am sure you will find there a couple of
interesting features for your scenario:

1/ groups are supported on all types of methods (@Test, or
configuration methods: @Before/@After Method/Class/Test)

2/ you can define group dependencies (for example: db.functional
depending on db.startup)

3/ the group filtering is handled by TestNG core (you will not be
required to code anything)

4/ you can define fixtures for special groups with @BeforeGroup and @AfterGroup

5/ and some more :-).

You are welcome to ask any questions and we will try to help you get
up to speed!

./alex
--
